entries.source: Chat Edit: 'Can you help me migrate my waybar code to quickshell? There are some functions I'd like to add to my status bar that just aren't possible with waybar, so I would like to move everything over to quickshell. I currently do not have quickshell installed, and may need to add extensions to my VSCode environment to accomplish this. Can you help?'

Chat Edit: 'Can you help clean up my quickshell directory and remove any unused files? I would like to publish my dotfiles to my github at https://github.com/bgibson72/yahr-quickshell, so it's imperative that things are nice and tidy. 

I will need a Readme.md file and help pushing everything to git. Include a list of required packages in the readme, if possible.'

Chat Edit: 'I believe we have set up a number of other customizations across several other packages that person who clones this repository will need in order for everything to work correctly on their end.

I believe the user will need to install fastfetch, kitty(if not already installed), hyprshot, nwg-look (for gtk themes and icons), pavucontrol for audio functionality, network-manager for network connections, the simple-update-notifier package, thunar file manager, and the gtk themes and icons from ~/.themes and ~/.icons. I can add a themes folder and icons folder to the git repo to make it easier for users to duplicate the yahr-quickshell without having to hunt them down elsewhere.'

Chat Edit: 'Perfect--thank you!

I would like to push several of my ~/.config directories up to github at https://github.com/bgibson72/yahr-quickshell.git. This should include everything affected by the theme switcher:

~/.config/hypr
~/.config/kitty
~/.config/mako
~/.config/nvim
~/.config/quickshell
~/.config/vesktop
~/.config/VSCodium

If I missed any, please include them as well.

The file structure on github is similar, but just config/ instead of .config/

BEFORE pushing the quickshell directory, make sure it's nice and organized and doesn't include any unecessary files. I would make sure all of the markup documentation is ignored by git except for a clear and concise README.md file.

'

Chat Edit: 'I revised the README.md file on the main repo, but we will need to update the quickshell readme.md file since it contains incorrect information after we removed the custom notifications, and push the changes to github.'
Chat Edit: 'We should also remove Zed since I never got that to work, and don't care to. As long as the neovim theming works, that's all that matters to me.'
Chat Edit: 'We should also remove Zed since I never got that to work, and don't care to. As long as the neovim theming works, that's all that matters to me.'

Chat Edit: 'If there was nothing custom done to get the mako notification service working and themable, then the mako documentation can be removed from the readme. It's not necessary to mention that it is replacing the quickshell notification system since the public won't have knowledge of it's existence before now.

We can also remove the Quick Start section of the main readme. '
